title: What is the difference between learning and education, and how should each serve me in my life? - Quora

response.answer_text: Education should light a fire in you: a deep need for knowledge, a curse to make you unhappy without it. Technically this is pulling you away from the spiritual ideal of detachment and not being specifically addicted to knowledge and contribution to society… but we’re talking about school. You can get all your seated meditation done when you own a house. Learning is a side-effect of that addiction, and the knowledge you build up, and the ability to analyze it, critically review it, will just increase. That’s what serves you - your ability to do things that other people value, with information or data that they see is important. Never confuse what other people value (C++ debugging, f’rinstance) with what is truly valuable: keep that hunger stoked.
